quote: Tammer is a brilliant engineer. He builds great apps and has done a superb job leading the engineering team at Engine Yard during a period of extremely rapid growth.

I see Tammer as more of a brother-in-arms than a manager. In a world filled with inefficient corporate double-speak like 'going forward,' 'circle back,' or 'blue sky thinking,' he's a straight-shooting breath of fresh air. Our team gets stuff done and has fun doing it, and Tammer deserves a lot of credit for fostering that sort of engineer-positive environment.

Tammer is the pragmatic CTO/VPE you wish you had and that every company needs. The only recommendation that should matter: Tammer is the person I recruited when our company restructured our engineering team to focus on product development and feature delivery. All hyperbole aside, he's the individual that you need to build and lead an engineering team when time to market matters.

Tammer is a great leader at Engine Yard. He is caring, understanding and good at pushing you in the right direction when you need it. He is a stand up guy and I am thrilled to work along side him on a daily basis.

Tammer is passionate about his team, the products he builds and the community he works in. He is responsible for bulding a world class engineering team at Engine Yard and for creating enormous customer and company value. He is straight forward, honest and dedicated to creating the best products in the industry.
Great to work with, intelligent feedback, exceptional quality.
Tammer is a top-notch developer, project manager, scotch afficionado, and all-around awesome dude.

Tammer has the extreme attention to detail and right kind of obsession with quality that most people have to lie about on their resumes.  As someone you can learn from everyday, he is both a pleasure and an asset to have as a colleague.

Tammer has a seemingly relentless passion for excellent software practices, and an exacting eye for both others' work and his own. He comes packed with energy and focus, and is constantly looking for ways to improve himself.  I've benefited directly from Tammer's assistance and advice, and will make sure I continue to do so.

Tammer was the guy at Caltech who could cut through the BS and get stuff done. He was very knowledgeable in the sys admin domain and kept the network together and improved it during his tenure at Caltech and left a legacy roadmap that was followed after he left.
Tammer was a great guy to work with. He was the brains behind Carbon Rally and other cool projects at Thoughtbot.
Quality guy and talented to boot.
Tammer has the mind and drive for writing disciplined, high-quality Ruby code.
Tammer Saleh is a Ruby developer that makes me weak. They shouldn’t be allowed to be this sexy. It’s like, against the Geneva Convention or something.
Instructors Tammer Saleh and Randall Thomas have succeeded in creating a fun and comprehensive avenue through which anyone can quickly and easily enter into the exciting world of Rails development.
short_quote: [Tammer has] succeeded in creating a fun and comprehensive avenue through which anyone can quickly and easily enter into the exciting world of Rails development.
